author: shemnon
msg: Fix breakage,
put out tree fire,
make the tomcat tests work completely again

author: costin
msg: - fixed Ajp12 - it now implements the shutdown function the same way as JServ.
That means starting and _stoping_ tomcat via mod_jserv wrapper should
work ( and you can do automatic startup - apachectl stop will also bring down
tomcat)
- Added code to the new starter to shut down tomcat ( using Ajp12). In order
for this to work you need to have the ajp12 adaper running. Same security
implications ( but it's easy to deny access to a port !). ( nothing new,
RMI had the same problems).
This give some time to think the RMI componenets.

author: costin
msg: - The new starter can now parse the old server.xml
It is still not equivalent - we still need to start the admin interface
using RMI. In the new model it will be just a normal component ( like
ant tasks ), but it has to be changed a bit before.
That means shutdown doesn't work with the new startup.Tomcat
- XmlHelper supports now few more mappings between xml tags and java
names ( in order to map server.xml to the existing java objects )

author: shemnon
msg: Added deliverable for milestone 2

author: costin
msg: - Added more debug messages where something was/is probably broken.
- Replaced the Mapper with a simplified one. It passes the test suite,
but it may miss something. It's one of the most importants things in the
lodo list - and probably the most critical component.
- Added the experimental startup, can be used to easily turn on
debug or test other combinations of interceptors/etc.
